revised_title: Fluid Refracting Telescope Construction by George Dollond
tldr: Peter Barlow describes the construction of a fluid refracting telescope made by George Dollond for the Royal Society. The telescope has an aperture of eight inches and a length of eight feet nine inches. Barlow discusses the principles and calculations he applied in the construction of the telescope and how its performance matched the computed results. The author leaves the evaluation of the telescope's performance to the Royal Society.
